about.title: About this publication
about.intro: Three quick notes on why I am writing, who this is for, and what you can expect.

whyNow.title: Why this, why now
whyNow.content:
I keep running the same loop:
- Building products with AI at the core
- Wrestling with TypeScript, Python, and Go
- Trying to make the products actually grow instead of just looking flashy

I keep thinking these attempts should not stay locked in my head.

So this blog is how I express it:
- Force myself to write down what I learn about AI, business, and indie products
- Share concrete cases instead of vague motivation
- Build a small corner for people who care about this stuff

I am not starting because I have figured it out—I am starting because I have not, and I want to document while I go.

community.title: Who I hope gathers here
community.content:
- You build things (or want to): apps, tools, scripts, services
- You are curious whether AI is useful in the real world, not just in hype or papers
- You care about software and business together: pricing, funnels, retention—not just clean code
- You like peeking behind the curtain: failed launches, messy dashboards, real trade-offs

The vibe I want:
- Less “thought leader,” more fellow builder leaving you long voice notes
- Less polished essays, more honest breakdowns, experiments, and failures
- Normal to talk about what worked, what was wasted effort, and what we will change next

I hope it becomes a small, nerdy, high-signal community of people who ship, share, and help each other avoid obvious cliffs.

expectations.title: What you can expect
expectations.content:
Topics
- AI and product: how I use LLMs in real products—prompts, architectures, failure cases, bright spots
- Indie dev and entrepreneurship: validating ideas, shipping fast, moving through uncertainty, small bets vs big bets
- Engineering notes: React/Next.js production patterns; Python/Go for backends, automation, and glue; deployment and monitoring

Cadence
- Target one post per week, depth-dependent
- Shorter field notes when I find something useful
- Longer stories when there is a full arc from idea -> launch -> results
- Prioritizing signal and sustainability over volume

Free vs paid
- Subscribe on Substack to read everything and get new drops: https://xibaoyuxi.substack.com
- If I ever add a paid tier, it would focus on deep case studies, build logs, or small-group AMAs, and I will keep it straightforward.
